refnamediv.refpurpose: Base class for widgets with two adjustable panes

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "max-position" gint : Read "min-position" gint : Read "position" gint : Read / Write "position-set" gboolean : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Child Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "resize" gboolean : Read / Write "shrink" gboolean : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Signal Prototypes
refsect1.synopsis: "accept-position" gboolean user_function (GtkPaned *paned, gpointer user_data); "cancel-position" gboolean user_function (GtkPaned *paned, gpointer user_data); "cycle-child-focus" gboolean user_function (GtkPaned *paned, gboolean arg1, gpointer user_data); "cycle-handle-focus" gboolean user_function (GtkPaned *paned, gboolean arg1, gpointer user_data); "move-handle" gboolean user_function (GtkPaned *paned, GtkScrollType arg1, gpointer user_data); "toggle-handle-focus" gboolean user_function (GtkPaned *paned, gpointer user_data);

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GtkPaned is the base class for widgets with two panes, arranged either horizontally (GtkHPaned) or vertically (GtkVPaned). Child widgets are added to the panes of the widget with gtk_paned_pack1() and gtk_paned_pack2(). The division beween the two children is set by default from the size requests of the children, but it can be adjusted by the user.

A paned widget draws a separator between the two child widgets and a small handle that the user can drag to adjust the division. It does not draw any relief around the children or around the separator. (The space in which the separator is called the gutter.) Often, it is useful to put each child inside a GtkFrame with the shadow type set to GTK_SHADOW_IN so that the gutter appears as a ridge.

Each child has two options that can be set, resize and shrink. If resize is true, then when the GtkPaned is resized, that child will expand or shrink along with the paned widget. If shrink is true, then when that child can be made smaller than its requisition by the user. Setting shrink to FALSE allows the application to set a minimum size. If resize is false for both children, then this is treated as if resize is true for both children.
The application can set the position of the slider as if it were set by the user, by calling gtk_paned_set_position().

example.title: Creating a paned widget with minimum sizes.

refsect2.title: gtk_paned_add1 ()
refsect2.para: Adds a child to the top or left pane with default parameters. This is equivalent to gtk_paned_pack1 (paned, child, FALSE, TRUE).

listitem.simpara: a paned widget
the child to add

refsect2.title: gtk_paned_add2 ()
refsect2.para: Adds a child to the bottom or right pane with default parameters. This is equivalent to gtk_paned_pack2 (paned, child, TRUE, TRUE).

listitem.simpara: a paned widget
the child to add

warning.para: gtk_paned_gutter_size is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.title: gtk_paned_pack1 ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_paned_pack1 (GtkPaned *paned, GtkWidget *child, gboolean resize, gboolean shrink);
refsect2.para: Adds a child to the top or left pane.

listitem.simpara: a paned widget
the child to add
should this child expand when the paned widget is resized.
can this child be made smaller than its requsition.

refsect2.title: gtk_paned_pack2 ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_paned_pack2 (GtkPaned *paned, GtkWidget *child, gboolean resize, gboolean shrink);
refsect2.para: Adds a child to the bottom or right pane.

listitem.simpara: a paned widget
the child to add
should this child expand when the paned widget is resized.
can this child be made smaller than its requsition.

refsect2.title: gtk_paned_get_child1 ()
refsect2.para: Obtains the first child of the paned widget.

listitem.simpara: a GtkPaned widget
first child, or NULL if it is not set.

refsect2.title: gtk_paned_get_child2 ()
refsect2.para: Obtains the second child of the paned widget.

listitem.simpara: a GtkPaned widget
second child, or NULL if it is not set.

refsect2.title: gtk_paned_set_gutter_size()

warning.para: gtk_paned_set_gutter_size is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: In older versions of GTK+, this function used to set the width of the gutter (the area between the two panes). It does nothing now.

listitem.simpara: a paned widget
the width of the gutter in pixels

refsect2.title: gtk_paned_set_position ()
refsect2.para: Sets the position of the divider between the two panes.

listitem.simpara: a GtkPaned widget
pixel position of divider, a negative value means that the position is unset.

refsect2.title: gtk_paned_get_position ()
refsect2.para: Obtains the position of the divider between the two panes.

listitem.simpara: a GtkPaned widget
position of the divider

listitem.para: The largest possible value for the position property. This property is derived from the size and shrinkability of the widget's children.
The smallest possible value for the position property. This property is derived from the size and shrinkability of the widget's children.
Position of paned separator in pixels (0 means all the way to the left/top).
TRUE if the Position property should be used.
The "resize" child property determines whether the child expands and shrinks along with the paned widget.
The "shrink" child property determines whether the child can be made smaller than its requisition.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
